abstract: Oracle’s technology for storing and managing data is at the heart of the modern business world, and its annual event draws 45,000 people, and their expense accounts.
snippet: Oracle’s technology for storing and managing data is at the heart of the modern business world, and its annual event draws 45,000 people, and their expense accounts.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Commuters driving into this city on Monday morning will discover major downtown thoroughfares closed. More than 129,000 square feet of tents will have sprouted around the city’s convention center, where 4.25 miles of power cables, 300 miles of phone and Internet wires and enough beer trucks to sate 45,000 people are in place.

headline.main: Oracle Convention Engulfs San Francisco With a Party Atmosphere
headline.print_headline: Oracle Convention Engulfs San Francisco With a Party Atmosphere

abstract: An analysis suggests that even if Oracle paid a big premium, it could reap a hefty return from acquiring Hewlett-Packard.
snippet: An analysis suggests that even if Oracle paid a big premium, it could reap a hefty return from acquiring Hewlett-Packard.
lead_paragraph: Investors unimpressed by Hewlett-Packard’s dysfunctional governance have sold off shares, leaving the tech company vulnerable to a bid. And Larry Ellison’s acquisitive Oracle is a credible potential suitor. A Breakingviews analysis suggests that even while paying a big premium, Oracle could reap a hefty return.

byline.original: By ROBERT CYRAN, RICHARD BEALES and ANTONY CURRIE
